Addendum 1 RFP JA-207652 Student and Sta.Bid_Summary: This is an addendum for RFP JA-207652 concerning student and staff computing devices for Dallas ISD. The purpose is to provide responses to vendor questions. Key points include a minimum requirement of USB 3.1 for monitors, etching for laptops only, specific OEM warranty requirements (1-year for Chromebooks, 3-years for Windows laptops), and software requirements like Autopilot for Windows and Google Management for Chromebooks. The award is anticipated for the August board meeting, with deliveries beginning in September 2024.
Product_Specification: Display monitor: USB 3.1 is a minimum requirement; higher specifications like 3.2 are permissible.
Etching: Required on Laptops only. Not required on stand-alone monitors or AIO computers.
Asset Services: Both etching and asset tagging are required for devices.
Warranty: Minimum one-year for student Chromebooks and three years for student and staff Windows laptops. All warranties must be from the OEM. Accidental Damage Protection is not required.
AIO Desktops: Must include a webcam.
Software Configuration: Windows devices require autopilot. Chromebooks require enrollment in Google Management.
Laptop Chargers: A 65w charger is the minimum requirement for Chrome devices.
Desktops: No requirement to be secured under or on a surface.

Student and Staff Computing Devices __SO.Bid_Summary: This Request for Proposal (RFP) from the Dallas Independent School District is for the procurement of student and staff computing devices, including laptops, desktops, tablet devices, and display monitors. The resulting contracts are expected to be for a term of five years. The RFP specifies minimum hardware requirements and includes services such as white-glove deployment, asset tagging, and etching. Vendors can propose solutions for one or multiple categories, and the district may award contracts to single or multiple vendors per category.
Product_Specification: Devices include laptops, desktops, tablet devices, and display monitors.
Display monitors must have a USB 3.1 port as a minimum requirement.
Laptop chargers for Chrome devices require a minimum of 65w.
A minimum one-year OEM warranty is required for student Chromebooks.
A minimum three-year OEM warranty is required for student and staff Windows laptops.
Accidental Damage Protection is not required.
White glove services are required, including asset decaling, asset reporting, etching (on Laptops only), and delivery.
For Windows devices, Autopilot is required.
For Chromebooks, enrollment in Google Management is required.
